title: Textile, ""Colombes et sangliers" (Doves and Boars)", ca. 1816–18
medium: Technique: Printed by engraved roller on cotton plain weave foundation.
dimensions:
Warp: 84.5cm (33 1/4). Weft: 62cm (24 1/2in.) Both edges cut but line where roller stopped, indicating a selvedge nearby,is on the left.
Pattern: Height of repeat: 25.5cm (10 in.)
description: Framed scenes, one a horizontal rectangle showing a putti in a chariot driven by a team of boars, the other a diamond showing doves feeding from abowl with vases, putti, masks, and herms, all on a background of intersecting circles. In deep purple red.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, ""Colombes et sangliers" (Doves and Boars)", ca. 1816–18.
ca. 1816–18. Technique: Printed by engraved roller on cotton plain weave foundation.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-59.
